column4: im trying to get a computer online that i just installed feisty on. the network shows up, the card shows up but it doesnt seem to connect. all available networks are in the list though and when i connect it still wont connect to any sites. anyone know what could be the problem?
how are you trying to access that computer
im not sure what you mean. its a computer in a different room, that i need to connect to the internet
you are trying to connect from where to where ?
ok so where is the problem ?
when i click the network icon to connect to my wireless network, it asks for the key, i type it in and it says connected but web pages wont load, and pings are unsucessful
okay
can you ping to your wireless router ?
would i ping 192.168.1.1? thats the pagwe i access to change settings
yes try to ping there
it is a page in your router/dsl modem to configure the modem. The router runs a mini-webserver in deed
can you ping or not ?
to ping 192.168.1.1 is unsuccessful
ok, try: sudo dhclient
dhdiscover 255.255.255.255 port 67
and in the end ... ?
it says something like that. the computer is upstairs so its hard to trouble shoot back and forth. brb
it says no dhcpoffers recieved
okay , iwlist scan ?
iwlist scan picks up 3 different wireless networks in my area, and lists info about them
is your modem also listed there ?
by modem do you mean wireless card? or my router?
yes your router
